Ingredients: main grains/legumes, seasonal vegetables, olive oil, herbs & spices
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.
HealthNotes: Low sugar and refined carbs; moderate healthy fats and lean protein to support liver health.

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Season fish lightly with herbs, lemon, and a small amount of oil. 3) Steam or bake until just cooked through to preserve moisture. 4) Serve immediately with steamed greens; avoid fried preparations.
HealthNotes: Low glycemic index, emphasizes complex carbohydrates and fiber to stabilize blood sugar.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Iron- and folate-rich ingredients; pairs with vitamin C sources to enhance absorption.

Ingredients: rolled oats, water or low-fat milk, nuts (almonds/walnuts), seeds (flax/chia), fresh berries or fruit
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook oats in water or low-fat milk over medium heat until soft. 3) Stir in seeds and nuts; simmer briefly; add fresh fruits or cinnamon for flavor. 4) Serve warm; portion control advised for diabetes/weight management.
HealthNotes: Soothing, low-acid, non-irritant foods; easily digestible preparations.

Ingredients: rolled oats, water or low-fat milk, nuts (almonds/walnuts), seeds (flax/chia), fresh berries or fruit, olive oil

Ingredients: firm tofu or tempeh, soy sauce (low sodium), mixed vegetables, garlic, ginger
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Press and cube tofu; marinate with low-sodium soy and spices. 3) Stir-fry on high heat with vegetables to retain texture. 4) Finish with a splash of lemon and chopped herbs; serve hot.
HealthNotes: Low sugar and refined carbs; moderate healthy fats and lean protein to support liver health.

Ingredients: lentils (moong/masoor), onion, tomato, turmeric, cumin, olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Sauté aromatics lightly in a bit of oil; add vegetables and low-sodium broth. 3) Simmer until vegetables are tender; season with herbs. 4) Blend partially or fully for a smooth texture if desired; serve warm.
HealthNotes: Balanced iodine and selenium sources, moderate calories to support metabolic health.

Ingredients: rolled oats, water or low-fat milk, nuts (almonds/walnuts), seeds (flax/chia), fresh berries or fruit
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook oats in water or low-fat milk over medium heat until soft. 3) Stir in seeds and nuts; simmer briefly; add fresh fruits or cinnamon for flavor. 4) Serve warm; portion control advised for diabetes/weight management.
HealthNotes: Non-acidic, low-fat options; avoid spicy, fried, and highly acidic foods to reduce reflux.

Ingredients: firm tofu or tempeh, soy sauce (low sodium), mixed vegetables, garlic, ginger
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Press and cube tofu; marinate with low-sodium soy and spices. 3) Stir-fry on high heat with vegetables to retain texture. 4) Finish with a splash of lemon and chopped herbs; serve hot.
HealthNotes: Mood-supporting nutrients: omega-3s, vitamin D, B vitamins, magnesium; balanced meals.

Ingredients: lentils (moong/masoor), onion, tomato, turmeric, cumin, olive oil

FoodName: Stir-fried Tempeh and Veggies with herbs
Ingredients: firm tofu or tempeh, soy sauce (low sodium), mixed vegetables, garlic, ginger, olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Press and cube tofu; marinate with low-sodium soy and spices. 3) Stir-fry on high heat with vegetables to retain texture. 4) Finish with a splash of lemon and chopped herbs; serve hot.
HealthNotes: Higher protein and low-glycemic carbohydrates to help regulate insulin and support hormones.

Ingredients: rolled oats, water or low-fat milk, nuts (almonds/walnuts), seeds (flax/chia), fresh berries or fruit
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook oats in water or low-fat milk over medium heat until soft. 3) Stir in seeds and nuts; simmer briefly; add fresh fruits or cinnamon for flavor. 4) Serve warm; portion control advised for diabetes/weight management.
HealthNotes: Low sugar and refined carbs; moderate healthy fats and lean protein to support liver health.

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Marinate protein/vegetables with minimal oil, herbs, and lemon. 3) Preheat grill or oven; cook until done, turning once for even cooking. 4) Serve with steamed vegetables or salad; avoid heavy sauces.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas

Ingredients: rolled oats, water or low-fat milk, nuts (almonds/walnuts), seeds (flax/chia), fresh berries or fruit, olive oil

HealthNotes: Lower-calorie meals with high fiber and protein to increase satiety and support weight loss.

PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Season fish lightly with herbs, lemon, and a small amount of oil. 3) Steam or bake until just cooked through to preserve moisture. 4) Serve immediately with steamed greens; avoid fried preparations.
HealthNotes: Strictly gluten-free ingredients (rice, quinoa, millet) to avoid autoimmune reaction.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Low sodium, emphasizes potassium-rich vegetables and lean proteins to support blood pressure.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Balanced iodine and selenium sources, moderate calories to support metabolic health.

Ingredients: rolled oats, water or low-fat milk, nuts (almonds/walnuts), seeds (flax/chia), fresh berries or fruit, olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook oats in water or low-fat milk over medium heat until soft. 3) Stir in seeds and nuts; simmer briefly; add fresh fruits or cinnamon for flavor. 4) Serve warm; portion control advised for diabetes/weight management.
HealthNotes: Rich in omega-3, fiber, and antioxidants; low in saturated/trans fats to support cardiovascular health.

Ingredients: main grains/legumes, seasonal vegetables, olive oil, herbs & spices
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.
HealthNotes: Low glycemic index, emphasizes complex carbohydrates and fiber to stabilize blood sugar.

FoodName: Miso Soup with Greens with quinoa
Ingredients: mixed vegetables, low-sodium broth, herbs, olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Sauté aromatics lightly in a bit of oil; add vegetables and low-sodium broth. 3) Simmer until vegetables are tender; season with herbs. 4) Blend partially or fully for a smooth texture if desired; serve warm.
HealthNotes: Rich in omega-3, fiber, and antioxidants; low in saturated/trans fats to support cardiovascular health.

FoodName: Chicken and Broccoli Stir Fry with herbs
Ingredients: lean chicken breast, garlic, yogurt (low-fat), spices (paprika, turmeric), olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.
HealthNotes: Soothing, low-acid, non-irritant foods; easily digestible preparations.

FoodName: Tuna Salad (olive oil dressing) and mixed veggies

PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: High soluble fiber and lean proteins to reduce LDL cholesterol.

FoodName: Tofu Stir Fry and mixed veggies
Ingredients: firm tofu or tempeh, soy sauce (low sodium), mixed vegetables, garlic, ginger
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Press and cube tofu; marinate with low-sodium soy and spices. 3) Stir-fry on high heat with vegetables to retain texture. 4) Finish with a splash of lemon and chopped herbs; serve hot.
HealthNotes: Balanced iodine and selenium sources, moderate calories to support metabolic health.

PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook oats in water or low-fat milk over medium heat until soft. 3) Stir in seeds and nuts; simmer briefly; add fresh fruits or cinnamon for flavor. 4) Serve warm; portion control advised for diabetes/weight management.
HealthNotes: Strictly gluten-free ingredients (rice, quinoa, millet) to avoid autoimmune reaction.

Ingredients: main grains/legumes, seasonal vegetables, olive oil, herbs & spices
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.
HealthNotes: Iron- and folate-rich ingredients; pairs with vitamin C sources to enhance absorption.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.

FoodName: Fish Tikka (tandoor style) and mixed veggies
Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Season fish lightly with herbs, lemon, and a small amount of oil. 3) Steam or bake until just cooked through to preserve moisture. 4) Serve immediately with steamed greens; avoid fried preparations.

PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.
HealthNotes: Non-acidic, low-fat options; avoid spicy, fried, and highly acidic foods to reduce reflux.

FoodName: Baked Cod with Herbs with herbs
Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Marinate protein/vegetables with minimal oil, herbs, and lemon. 3) Preheat grill or oven; cook until done, turning once for even cooking. 4) Serve with steamed vegetables or salad; avoid heavy sauces.
HealthNotes: Balanced iodine and selenium sources, moderate calories to support metabolic health.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Strictly gluten-free ingredients (rice, quinoa, millet) to avoid autoimmune reaction.

PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Sauté aromatics lightly in a bit of oil; add vegetables and low-sodium broth. 3) Simmer until vegetables are tender; season with herbs. 4) Blend partially or fully for a smooth texture if desired; serve warm.
HealthNotes: Low glycemic index, emphasizes complex carbohydrates and fiber to stabilize blood sugar.

Ingredients: main grains/legumes, seasonal vegetables, olive oil, herbs & spices
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Marinate protein/vegetables with minimal oil, herbs, and lemon. 3) Preheat grill or oven; cook until done, turning once for even cooking. 4) Serve with steamed vegetables or salad; avoid heavy sauces.
HealthNotes: Lower sodium and potassium when needed; moderate protein and controlled phosphorus.

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Marinate protein/vegetables with minimal oil, herbs, and lemon. 3) Preheat grill or oven; cook until done, turning once for even cooking. 4) Serve with steamed vegetables or salad; avoid heavy sauces.
HealthNotes: Iron- and folate-rich ingredients; pairs with vitamin C sources to enhance absorption.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Mood-supporting nutrients: omega-3s, vitamin D, B vitamins, magnesium; balanced meals.

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Season fish lightly with herbs, lemon, and a small amount of oil. 3) Steam or bake until just cooked through to preserve moisture. 4) Serve immediately with steamed greens; avoid fried preparations.
HealthNotes: Non-acidic, low-fat options; avoid spicy, fried, and highly acidic foods to reduce reflux.

FoodName: Mixed Vegetable Sambar and mixed veggies
Ingredients: spinach, onion, pepper, olive oil spray, olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.
HealthNotes: Soothing, low-acid, non-irritant foods; easily digestible preparations.

Ingredients: rolled oats, water or low-fat milk, nuts (almonds/walnuts), seeds (flax/chia), fresh berries or fruit, olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook oats in water or low-fat milk over medium heat until soft. 3) Stir in seeds and nuts; simmer briefly; add fresh fruits or cinnamon for flavor. 4) Serve warm; portion control advised for diabetes/weight management.
HealthNotes: Higher protein and low-glycemic carbohydrates to help regulate insulin and support hormones.

PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.
HealthNotes: Rich in omega-3, fiber, and antioxidants; low in saturated/trans fats to support cardiovascular health.

Ingredients: rolled oats, water or low-fat milk, nuts (almonds/walnuts), seeds (flax/chia), fresh berries or fruit
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook oats in water or low-fat milk over medium heat until soft. 3) Stir in seeds and nuts; simmer briefly; add fresh fruits or cinnamon for flavor. 4) Serve warm; portion control advised for diabetes/weight management.

FoodName: Baked Cod with Herbs with spinach
Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Marinate protein/vegetables with minimal oil, herbs, and lemon. 3) Preheat grill or oven; cook until done, turning once for even cooking. 4) Serve with steamed vegetables or salad; avoid heavy sauces.
HealthNotes: Low glycemic index, emphasizes complex carbohydrates and fiber to stabilize blood sugar.

PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Balanced iodine and selenium sources, moderate calories to support metabolic health.

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Marinate protein/vegetables with minimal oil, herbs, and lemon. 3) Preheat grill or oven; cook until done, turning once for even cooking. 4) Serve with steamed vegetables or salad; avoid heavy sauces.
HealthNotes: Lower sodium and potassium when needed; moderate protein and controlled phosphorus.

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Season fish lightly with herbs, lemon, and a small amount of oil. 3) Steam or bake until just cooked through to preserve moisture. 4) Serve immediately with steamed greens; avoid fried preparations.
HealthNotes: Rich in omega-3, fiber, and antioxidants; low in saturated/trans fats to support cardiovascular health.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Low glycemic index, emphasizes complex carbohydrates and fiber to stabilize blood sugar.

Ingredients: firm tofu or tempeh, soy sauce (low sodium), mixed vegetables, garlic, ginger, olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Press and cube tofu; marinate with low-sodium soy and spices. 3) Stir-fry on high heat with vegetables to retain texture. 4) Finish with a splash of lemon and chopped herbs; serve hot.
HealthNotes: Low glycemic index, emphasizes complex carbohydrates and fiber to stabilize blood sugar.

Ingredients: paneer or halloumi, bell peppers, olive oil, spinach or greens
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.
HealthNotes: Strictly gluten-free ingredients (rice, quinoa, millet) to avoid autoimmune reaction.

PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Marinate protein/vegetables with minimal oil, herbs, and lemon. 3) Preheat grill or oven; cook until done, turning once for even cooking. 4) Serve with steamed vegetables or salad; avoid heavy sauces.
HealthNotes: Lower-calorie meals with high fiber and protein to increase satiety and support weight loss.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Low sodium, emphasizes potassium-rich vegetables and lean proteins to support blood pressure.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas

HealthNotes: Mood-supporting nutrients: omega-3s, vitamin D, B vitamins, magnesium; balanced meals.

Ingredients: rolled oats, water or low-fat milk, nuts (almonds/walnuts), seeds (flax/chia), fresh berries or fruit, olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook oats in water or low-fat milk over medium heat until soft. 3) Stir in seeds and nuts; simmer briefly; add fresh fruits or cinnamon for flavor. 4) Serve warm; portion control advised for diabetes/weight management.
HealthNotes: Strictly gluten-free ingredients (rice, quinoa, millet) to avoid autoimmune reaction.

Ingredients: main grains/legumes, seasonal vegetables, olive oil, herbs & spices
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.
HealthNotes: Low glycemic index, emphasizes complex carbohydrates and fiber to stabilize blood sugar.

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Season fish lightly with herbs, lemon, and a small amount of oil. 3) Steam or bake until just cooked through to preserve moisture. 4) Serve immediately with steamed greens; avoid fried preparations.
HealthNotes: Mood-supporting nutrients: omega-3s, vitamin D, B vitamins, magnesium; balanced meals.

HealthNotes: Balanced iodine and selenium sources, moderate calories to support metabolic health.

FoodName: Tuna Salad (olive oil dressing) with spinach
Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: High soluble fiber and lean proteins to reduce LDL cholesterol.

HealthNotes: Non-acidic, low-fat options; avoid spicy, fried, and highly acidic foods to reduce reflux.

FoodName: Vegetable Sushi Bowl and mixed veggies
Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Low glycemic index, emphasizes complex carbohydrates and fiber to stabilize blood sugar.

Ingredients: mixed vegetables, low-sodium broth, herbs, olive oil

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Marinate protein/vegetables with minimal oil, herbs, and lemon. 3) Preheat grill or oven; cook until done, turning once for even cooking. 4) Serve with steamed vegetables or salad; avoid heavy sauces.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Mood-supporting nutrients: omega-3s, vitamin D, B vitamins, magnesium; balanced meals.

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Season fish lightly with herbs, lemon, and a small amount of oil. 3) Steam or bake until just cooked through to preserve moisture. 4) Serve immediately with steamed greens; avoid fried preparations.
HealthNotes: Strictly gluten-free ingredients (rice, quinoa, millet) to avoid autoimmune reaction.

HealthNotes: Strictly gluten-free ingredients (rice, quinoa, millet) to avoid autoimmune reaction.

Ingredients: rolled oats, water or low-fat milk, nuts (almonds/walnuts), seeds (flax/chia), fresh berries or fruit

HealthNotes: Balanced iodine and selenium sources, moderate calories to support metabolic health.

PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.

Ingredients: mixed vegetables, low-sodium broth, herbs, olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Sauté aromatics lightly in a bit of oil; add vegetables and low-sodium broth. 3) Simmer until vegetables are tender; season with herbs. 4) Blend partially or fully for a smooth texture if desired; serve warm.
HealthNotes: Soothing, low-acid, non-irritant foods; easily digestible preparations.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Balanced iodine and selenium sources, moderate calories to support metabolic health.

PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Rich in omega-3, fiber, and antioxidants; low in saturated/trans fats to support cardiovascular health.

Ingredients: spinach, onion, pepper, olive oil spray, olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.
HealthNotes: Soothing, low-acid, non-irritant foods; easily digestible preparations.

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Season fish lightly with herbs, lemon, and a small amount of oil. 3) Steam or bake until just cooked through to preserve moisture. 4) Serve immediately with steamed greens; avoid fried preparations.
HealthNotes: Low sugar and refined carbs; moderate healthy fats and lean protein to support liver health.

FoodName: Lemon Herb Fish and mixed veggies
Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Season fish lightly with herbs, lemon, and a small amount of oil. 3) Steam or bake until just cooked through to preserve moisture. 4) Serve immediately with steamed greens; avoid fried preparations.

PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.
HealthNotes: Low glycemic index, emphasizes complex carbohydrates and fiber to stabilize blood sugar.

FoodName: Avocado Toast with Seeds and mixed veggies
Ingredients: egg whites, spinach, onion, pepper, olive oil spray
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.
HealthNotes: Soothing, low-acid, non-irritant foods; easily digestible preparations.

Ingredients: main grains/legumes, seasonal vegetables, olive oil, herbs & spices
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Marinate protein/vegetables with minimal oil, herbs, and lemon. 3) Preheat grill or oven; cook until done, turning once for even cooking. 4) Serve with steamed vegetables or salad; avoid heavy sauces.
HealthNotes: Rich in omega-3, fiber, and antioxidants; low in saturated/trans fats to support cardiovascular health.

Ingredients: lentils (moong/masoor), onion, tomato, turmeric, cumin, olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Sauté aromatics lightly in a bit of oil; add vegetables and low-sodium broth. 3) Simmer until vegetables are tender; season with herbs. 4) Blend partially or fully for a smooth texture if desired; serve warm.
HealthNotes: Lower-calorie meals with high fiber and protein to increase satiety and support weight loss.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Low glycemic index, emphasizes complex carbohydrates and fiber to stabilize blood sugar.

Ingredients: rolled oats, water or low-fat milk, nuts (almonds/walnuts), seeds (flax/chia), fresh berries or fruit, olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook oats in water or low-fat milk over medium heat until soft. 3) Stir in seeds and nuts; simmer briefly; add fresh fruits or cinnamon for flavor. 4) Serve warm; portion control advised for diabetes/weight management.
HealthNotes: Balanced iodine and selenium sources, moderate calories to support metabolic health.

PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.
HealthNotes: High soluble fiber and lean proteins to reduce LDL cholesterol.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Mood-supporting nutrients: omega-3s, vitamin D, B vitamins, magnesium; balanced meals.

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Marinate protein/vegetables with minimal oil, herbs, and lemon. 3) Preheat grill or oven; cook until done, turning once for even cooking. 4) Serve with steamed vegetables or salad; avoid heavy sauces.
HealthNotes: Low sugar and refined carbs; moderate healthy fats and lean protein to support liver health.

FoodName: Avocado Toast with Seeds with quinoa
Ingredients: main grains/legumes, seasonal vegetables, olive oil, herbs & spices
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.
HealthNotes: Soothing, low-acid, non-irritant foods; easily digestible preparations.

Ingredients: rolled oats, water or low-fat milk, nuts (almonds/walnuts), seeds (flax/chia), fresh berries or fruit, olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook oats in water or low-fat milk over medium heat until soft. 3) Stir in seeds and nuts; simmer briefly; add fresh fruits or cinnamon for flavor. 4) Serve warm; portion control advised for diabetes/weight management.
HealthNotes: Non-acidic, low-fat options; avoid spicy, fried, and highly acidic foods to reduce reflux.

Ingredients: lentils (moong/masoor), onion, tomato, turmeric, cumin
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.
HealthNotes: Low sodium, emphasizes potassium-rich vegetables and lean proteins to support blood pressure.

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Season fish lightly with herbs, lemon, and a small amount of oil. 3) Steam or bake until just cooked through to preserve moisture. 4) Serve immediately with steamed greens; avoid fried preparations.
HealthNotes: Mood-supporting nutrients: omega-3s, vitamin D, B vitamins, magnesium; balanced meals.

HealthNotes: Rich in omega-3, fiber, and antioxidants; low in saturated/trans fats to support cardiovascular health.

FoodName: Baked Cod with Herbs with spinach
Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Marinate protein/vegetables with minimal oil, herbs, and lemon. 3) Preheat grill or oven; cook until done, turning once for even cooking. 4) Serve with steamed vegetables or salad; avoid heavy sauces.
HealthNotes: Higher protein and low-glycemic carbohydrates to help regulate insulin and support hormones.

FoodName: Stir-fried Tempeh and Veggies with herbs
Ingredients: firm tofu or tempeh, soy sauce (low sodium), mixed vegetables, garlic, ginger, olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Press and cube tofu; marinate with low-sodium soy and spices. 3) Stir-fry on high heat with vegetables to retain texture. 4) Finish with a splash of lemon and chopped herbs; serve hot.
HealthNotes: High soluble fiber and lean proteins to reduce LDL cholesterol.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Strictly gluten-free ingredients (rice, quinoa, millet) to avoid autoimmune reaction.

HealthNotes: Strictly gluten-free ingredients (rice, quinoa, millet) to avoid autoimmune reaction.

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Season fish lightly with herbs, lemon, and a small amount of oil. 3) Steam or bake until just cooked through to preserve moisture. 4) Serve immediately with steamed greens; avoid fried preparations.
HealthNotes: Higher protein and low-glycemic carbohydrates to help regulate insulin and support hormones.

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Marinate protein/vegetables with minimal oil, herbs, and lemon. 3) Preheat grill or oven; cook until done, turning once for even cooking. 4) Serve with steamed vegetables or salad; avoid heavy sauces.
HealthNotes: High soluble fiber and lean proteins to reduce LDL cholesterol.

Ingredients: lentils (moong/masoor), onion, tomato, turmeric, cumin, olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Sauté aromatics lightly in a bit of oil; add vegetables and low-sodium broth. 3) Simmer until vegetables are tender; season with herbs. 4) Blend partially or fully for a smooth texture if desired; serve warm.
HealthNotes: Rich in omega-3, fiber, and antioxidants; low in saturated/trans fats to support cardiovascular health.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Iron- and folate-rich ingredients; pairs with vitamin C sources to enhance absorption.

HealthNotes: Balanced iodine and selenium sources, moderate calories to support metabolic health.

Ingredients: mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, quinoa or chickpeas
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.
HealthNotes: Lower sodium and potassium when needed; moderate protein and controlled phosphorus.

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Season fish lightly with herbs, lemon, and a small amount of oil. 3) Steam or bake until just cooked through to preserve moisture. 4) Serve immediately with steamed greens; avoid fried preparations.
HealthNotes: Low sodium, emphasizes potassium-rich vegetables and lean proteins to support blood pressure.

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Marinate protein/vegetables with minimal oil, herbs, and lemon. 3) Preheat grill or oven; cook until done, turning once for even cooking. 4) Serve with steamed vegetables or salad; avoid heavy sauces.
HealthNotes: Lower sodium and potassium when needed; moderate protein and controlled phosphorus.

Ingredients: rolled oats, water or low-fat milk, nuts (almonds/walnuts), seeds (flax/chia), fresh berries or fruit
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook oats in water or low-fat milk over medium heat until soft. 3) Stir in seeds and nuts; simmer briefly; add fresh fruits or cinnamon for flavor. 4) Serve warm; portion control advised for diabetes/weight management.
HealthNotes: Low glycemic index, emphasizes complex carbohydrates and fiber to stabilize blood sugar.

Ingredients: main grains/legumes, seasonal vegetables, olive oil, herbs & spices
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook base ingredients (grains/legumes) until al dente. 3) Lightly sauté vegetables; combine with base and season minimally. 4) Serve warm and garnish with herbs/seeds.

Ingredients: rolled oats, water or low-fat milk, nuts (almonds/walnuts), seeds (flax/chia), fresh berries or fruit, olive oil

HealthNotes: Balanced iodine and selenium sources, moderate calories to support metabolic health.

PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Cook any base (quinoa, rice or legumes) until tender and let cool. 3) Chop fresh vegetables and herbs; combine with base and protein source. 4) Dress lightly with olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt; toss and serve.

Ingredients: fresh fish fillet, lemon, garlic, olive oil, mixed herbs
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Season fish lightly with herbs, lemon, and a small amount of oil. 3) Steam or bake until just cooked through to preserve moisture. 4) Serve immediately with steamed greens; avoid fried preparations.
HealthNotes: Non-acidic, low-fat options; avoid spicy, fried, and highly acidic foods to reduce reflux.

FoodName: Stir-fried Tempeh and Veggies with spinach
Ingredients: firm tofu or tempeh, soy sauce (low sodium), mixed vegetables, garlic, ginger, olive oil
PreparationSteps: 1) Prepare and measure ingredients: wash and chop vegetables, rinse grains/legumes if needed. 2) Press and cube tofu; marinate with low-sodium soy and spices. 3) Stir-fry on high heat with vegetables to retain texture. 4) Finish with a splash of lemon and chopped herbs; serve hot.
HealthNotes: Non-acidic, low-fat options; avoid spicy, fried, and highly acidic foods to reduce reflux.
